page.title: 13LIFE IN THE DALES (2)
page.content: Life in the Yorkshire Dales in winter is hard, with the wind moaning through the trees and howling round the house. Outside the land is covered with snow and farmers have to struggle to find their sheep in the drifts. Spring sometimes still means snow, and hoping that the ewes can be got in before lambing starts. Spring also means green fields and lambs leaping and playing. Summer is the smell of freshly cut grass being dried in the sun ready for haytime. It also means the sound of people enjoying themselves swimming in the river, or walking, pack on back, along the Pennine Way. Autumn is the time for children to gather conkers, whilst the leaves turn orange, red and golden brown. This is what I remember about the place I live--the Yorkshire Dales. (Girl, aged 16)
